author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

segments.pli: Kathaṃ paribhoti, kathikaṃ paribhoti, attānaṃ paribhoti, duppañño hoti jaḷo eḷamūgo, anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
segments.en: They disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re witless, dull, and stupid. They think they know what they don’t know.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
segments.en: Someone with these five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.

segments.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
segments.en: Someone with five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.

segments.pli: Na kathaṃ paribhoti, na kathikaṃ paribhoti, na attānaṃ paribhoti, paññavā hoti ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, na anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
segments.en: They don’t disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re wise, not dull and stupid. They don’t think they know what they don’t know.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.
segments.en: Someone with these five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
